intro: Tacazzea galactagoga, commonly known as the milkweed of the genus Tacazzea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically oval and arranged oppositely along the stem. Tacazzea galactagoga is often found in woodland and shrubland habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
